page.title: 19 NEWS OF THE DAY
page.content: The Albatross Gliding Club wants to build a new airfield at Newnham Park. It is to have a new club house and glider hanger.Their club is now at Camelford in Cornwall but lots of members live in Plymouth and want it to be closer. A local commercial airline based at Plymouth Airport object to the airfield as it could cause danger for aircrafts going to and from Plymouth Airport.The C.A.A.want a special safety agreement put forward if the club is to be built.The airport manager said that an agreement like this would be completely unworkable. Council planners are considering the plans.There will be a public inquiry on the 13 August. By July 2nd work had already started on leveling the proposed site.
